intro: Oxytropis guilanica, commonly known as the Guilan oxytropis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of northern Iran. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Oxytropis guilanica is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
